biography.summary: Sheldon Whitehouse is an American lawyer and politician serving as the United States Senator from Rhode Island since 2007. He previously served as Rhode Island's Attorney General from 1999 to 2003.
biography.early_life: Born October 20, 1955, in New Haven, Connecticut. He earned a BA from Williams College and a JD from the University of Virginia School of Law.
biography.education: BA Williams College (1977); JD University of Virginia School of Law (1982).
biography.career: Before entering the Senate, Whitehouse served as Rhode Island's Attorney General (1999â€“2003).
